text: Our farmers, grocery store employees, truck drivers, and warehouse operators have shown incredible determination as we fight the spread of COVID-19. Thank you for keeping our shelves stocked and putting food on our tables during these challenging times. https://t.co/d2niZsxwRj

Starting today, Wyoming small business owners can apply for Paycheck Protection Plan loans. These loans can be used to help keep employees on your payroll. Learn more in my latest newsletter: https://t.co/K2OAflUSJG https://t.co/2ZM8owG1Ai

I’m pleased to see the EPA support empowering states like Wyoming to have control over our carbon sequestration enforcement. This will enhance Wyoming’s energy production opportunities, creating more jobs and economic growth for our state. Learn more: https://t.co/1VIAfNH3xL https://t.co/PLapEEBq21

Read here to see if you are eligible for economic impact payments and if you need to take any action: https://t.co/uSjHHHma34 https://t.co/HZGZZWVDHe

Wyoming small business owners: The CARES Act provides $349 billion in loans through the Paycheck Protection Program (PPP). The loans provide 8 weeks of cash-flow assistance to small businesses who maintain their payroll. Learn more on applying here: https://t.co/vwBpkwUEMx

Here's the latest update about action being taken to combat and defeat coronavirus, as well as answers to important questions about the distribution of economic impact payments that were a part of the CARES Act: https://t.co/v4V4EENecS https://t.co/coAcdSONe3

I have instructed staff in my office and in House GOP Conference office to begin working from home. I will continue to work at the Capitol as we have votes, but we need to do everything we can to slow transmission of this virus & reduce numbers of people who could be exposed.

For members of the @AmericanLegion, their mission is not over. They continue to serve their fellow veterans, their communities, and our country. Thank you to Commander Myron Cooke of Rock Springs, Keith Davidson of Hulett, and Jim Lish of Cheyenne for meeting with me today. https://t.co/yCcXy4FXZm

It’s a privilege to represent Wyoming in Congress and fight for our values in Washington. 307 Day gives us a chance to celebrate the history and beauty of Wyoming, and I hope you’ll join me today in honoring the best our state has to offer. #WY307 https://t.co/ryEqO08bAJ

This week my team had the honor of presenting Cheyenne resident Joe Dougherty with medals his father, John, had earned serving in WWII. He received a WWII Victory Medal and Honorable Service Lapel Button. If you know a veteran needing medals replaced, call my office: 307-772-2595 https://t.co/1C0dsMwA9K
